noun.description: A genus of small cruciferous herbs, widespread in temperate Eurasia and North America, and found especially in dry, sandy, stony, or saline habitats. Also (also in form arabidopsis): a plant of this genus; (in later use) especially thale cress, Arabidopsis thaliana, which has simple leaves and white flowers, and is used widely in studies of plant genetics.

origin: Mid 19th century. From scientific Latin Arabidopsis (A. P. de Candolle Regni vegetabilis systema naturale II. 480; adopted as a genus name by G. Heynhold in F. Holl & G. Heynhold Flora von Sachsen I. 538) from Arabis, genus name + -d- (after Latin nouns in -id-, -is; compare -id) + ancient Greek ὄψις appearance.
